context: The word 'meidän' is a possessive pronoun in Finnish. It means 'our' or 'ours', and it is the genitive plural form of 'me' (we). The '-mme' suffix indicates possession by 'we'.  It can also be used to express obligation, as in 'Meidän pitää tehdä tämä nyt' which translates to 'We have to do this now'.
